posts.body:
Test.
This shit wasn't working at all yesterday, giving me an "Error while during request: Forbidden" all day. Seemed like just waiting the day out worked, assuming you can see this.
OP really should have made it more clear. I might be retarded but nothing about the OP makes it clear that ZeroID is outright required to post now. I had enabled multiuser on Zeronet and figured it was good enough, which seemed to cause the ZeroID issue in the first place. Had to go to the cake kike's bunker of all places to ask for solutions since I couldn't post, and seems like I wasn't the only one it was fucked for.

>>27e2ad17-3de9-4304-b868-c393c59b70d5
Yeah, it's called vch. He made it with Gahoole, the /tv/ faggot, I think. It was such a shitshow that IPs were visible to Mark when it first launched.
>>1f48a4ed-c17e-4296-b02b-f7cffab684fd
>>93fc6f5e-cbf2-43bc-bd4b-9a85b0f521d5
I can see you, (((Joe Biden)))
The webm doesn't seem to load but the image did so it might just be taking a while to buffer or something.

>>fb3a3090-535b-492d-88fc-916296dbce71
It says 0 peers on the webm so it 's probably something similar.
The images do a strange thing. You see the circle where it's loading? It will show a thumbnail of the image, spinning inside the  little circle. I need to click on it again to expand it to full size, then click it a third time to make it small again for it to show up normally.
Might be because I have boards pinned, but even leaving Zeronet on overnight while having the browser turned on, it seemed to download as much as it uploaded.

>please see instructions here
<page is blank

The main things I want are privacy and optimization. I could deal with a text-only site (wouldn't even really mind one all that much) if it ran well enough.
So, 4, 5, 6, 11, and especially 13.
I'd think that 14 should be avoided at all costs, because you know that the glowniggers will try to stream some shooting on here.
16 should be avoided as well, this isn't Reddit.

Also 12 would be nice for nostalgia.
Is there a reason why some of these things would take so long? My minimal experience with making my own website, CSS wasn't THAT hard. Hell, I made a couple CSSes for that Honest Gaming project that had a tiny bit of traction a while ago on full/v/, and it took me an evening. Is Millchan significantly more complicated for some reason? I suppose there's a lot more to change, as it's far more than just the color scheme, but half a year for a site design is steep.

Also, I don't mind things taking a long time. As far as we know, the main site will come back. But we need to be ready in the case of, say, a 2020 democrat sweep which would mean "extremist" sites would get shoahed to hell. This site will be useful in the future as well.

posts.subject: Video games?
posts.body: This place has devolved into nothing but metafaggotry, trying to get ZeroNet to work. Please talk about actual video games every once in a while, too.
posts.files: [{"name":"2342a235d388a73687fcda44d38e6fb - girl abs armpits arms up bangs black gloves black ribbon bodysuit breasts covered navel dark skin gloves goomrrat grey eyes grey hair hair between eyes.jpg","thumb":"865303225d9830c48f602983c923749903706343-thumb.jpg","size":381705,"type":"image/jpeg","original":"865303225d9830c48f602983c923749903706343.jpg","directory":"18FRxEBcX5sJYsL8moeLxw8ipms4ns6u75"}]

posts.body:
>>de2155fa-c7b1-4485-8c56-917137547b7a
Should have submitted it to Frame Fatales, the "all-female" GDQ.
>What /v/ related things are you working on?
Gonna start up work on my /agdg/ project again, came up with a character redesign as I was going to bed and the mockup I did was really nice.
Been busy lately so have had no time for it. Was playing Autismcraft until then, messing around with redstone.

>>0715f43c-2d74-48fe-aca5-e9589e444dda
ESA's second stream, then?

>>c45e64fe-d2ab-4265-a97f-1fa339220dd0
Does that emulate well? It'd be fun to give it a shot but I already have so little time that I'm scared of getting lost in Animal Crossing again. Put five hundred hours into New Leaf **twice**. I hope they show more of New Horizons soon, the QOL in that looks fucking great, I just hope they improve the dialogue.

>>8c99af3a-e6db-473c-bde8-a6568dacf5f4
Speaking of, how is emulation in general? I really haven't kept up. Is PS3 usable for anything that isn't Persona 5 by now? Last I used Wii U, it would constantly need to build and rebuild caches. Is Switch emulation any good now? I've seen it have the capability of running pretty well, but I assume it needs a ridiculous PC to work.
I really need to schedule shit out better, it seems like I have no time for vidya at all.

>>af5c083c-0ce2-4a01-b406-8162018b725a
I remember emulating RE4 on an office computer with 32mb of video memory seven or eight years ago, it seems like it has barely improved at all. Do people seriously not care about the PS2? I know the architecture of it was notoriously annoying to work with, but you'd think the most popular console of all time would get some love. The DS was annoying but its emulation isn't that bad.

>>69acb0d7-74c2-415b-8228-dbf22e6c1974
>Mostly people head towards projects that can either bring in donations or increase their E-peen with little effort. 
Which is pretty much why Wii U emulation is centered on BotW, huh? Does the Switch have something similar, where it's just one game as the focus?

>>cc3763c1-d3cc-46f5-8902-3a0d65bbfa0d
But why BotW, if it already runs at 4k with patches and mods and shit on Wii U? You'd think Switch emu would at least focus on Odyssey, Smash or Pokemon.
I hope people get around to modding SwSh at some point. Haven't played Pokemon in a while.

>>7288940f-c4bc-455e-8df2-de0b6ad0a6e9
I really don't get the concept of paying for emulation. At that point, you might as well just buy the game used or something.

>>21ec2a8e-c63a-40e6-b3c2-d60c9d090501
What's a good Fire Emblem game to start with if you've never touched the series? It's one of those Dark Souls cases where I've never heard anyone actually praise one of the games, just shit on them and argue about which one's worse.
>>407ed68e-d1ef-426b-a2f4-b0eb2a6160ae
I consider all my posts to be gone anyway once the thread slides off the catalog, even if archives exist. Who really cares?

For all the Fire Emblem talk, how's Three Houses supposed to be, anyway? There was a Tetris 99 special event where you can get a Three Houses skin for the game. The character designs looked fucking gay.

Finally got some time to play vidya today. Xenoblade 2, mainly. Xenoblade 1 and 2 are beautiful and I wish they were on PC (properly, not emulated), with better texture work. The worlds are fucking amazing.

>>671684a7-d888-4e3c-999f-ade4c42bace0
Sounds like Fire Emblem with extra busywork, from what you're describing. I suppose it's good that it's not total shit, like I've heard Awakening was.

>>f5754536-5215-49dd-80d3-252c0a5a2fe6
Anons from other bunkers won't ever trust this place over muh YOU'RE ALWAYS SEEDING CP NO MATTER WHAT YOU CAN NEVER AVOID IT.  I think that working on issues for the future is important, especially anonymity. True anonymity really needs to be established somehow before many anons will even consider posting here. IP addresses need to be hidden and so do ZeroID accounts. It's important to keep muting as a feature, yes, but these are important elements of an imageboard.

>>21005c49-cd55-4fb8-9749-7aac005e84cd
>>56995c54-54af-42a4-8dcc-420b4d2f594b
>>a961d93f-a5cd-4a3a-b7eb-5d62fe366e91
Do you have a black sideways triangle after the post number? Click on that, it gives you the option to mute a user or help seed their files.

posts.subject: Cripplekike's smoking gun
posts.body:
So Fred threw a tantrum yesterday, threatening to leak a "big secret" about Mark.
It got posted to IRC and Mark made an official announcement.

>Hey everyone, since it's about to leak out then I might as well tell you first hand.

>Jim is currently helping me out during a time of crisis and I'm very thankful for the small sum of money that I get. When my mother was dying, my dad lost his store and my home was kicking me out. I didn't have a choice but to ask around my circles for a job. Despite not having much room, Jim took me in, gave me some tasks and allowed me to keep both food and shelter in my life.

>I don't get paid for the /v/ stuff, this is more of a hobby than anything. However I DO get paid for running some basic errands like claims and such, so that codemonkey can focus on more important things on 8chan and the other sites that he works on. Thanks to Jim and Ron, I'm able to safely live in this shit hole of a city with food on my plate and shelter over my head. 

>Unlike Frederick I can appreciate the shit Jim has done for me, and the only regret I have is that I couldn't tell people sooner. However due to wanting to avoid a potential exodus, Codemonkey wished for me to keep my job a secret. I disagreed with him, but I also respected his wishes. Now that Fredrick blackmailed me and basically leaked it to those in IRC. I figured it's basically a good time to tell you all the truth about how I get a bit of cash each month by helping out Codemonkey and Jim with basic errands for the site. I do NOT have higher access to certain information since I am a lower level employee. 

After asking, Mark basically confirmed that it mostly boils down to testing Ron's code on /v/ before it's rolled out site-wide.

Figured the anons here would be interested in knowing. Any thoughts?
http://archive.is/VRPOa
http://archive.is/xV3AX

>>20a35588-37e2-4403-a2fc-b4f3d5b3459c
Ask cripplekike.
I think that his "juicy drops for the fifth" were a separate matter. Seems like he only started threatening Mark yesterday.
I appreciate the efforts of the anon who dumps images every day here.

It went free to play and there's nothing more to it, in regards to the russians in particular. Slavs are addicted as shit to anything F2P. They love TF2, they love Dota, they love Counter Strike, they love LoL and they love Fortnite.
Matchmaking and lol le funny hats eks dee didn't help.

One of the loading screen tips is "Grenades are like stream chats - unusable without mods."
Even if you knew nothing whatsoever about the series or the cuckolds behind it, this one quote should tell you everything you need to know.
**No, I didn't buy it. A buddy of mine did, despite my best efforts.**

A good start. Of course, I will always be wary of moderation, as moderators often end up being corrupt. But it's certainly a great start for those who are wary of CP. Please keep working on features, anons.

Though I will add that I wish the categories were more separate. I wouldn't classify Loli under the same shit as, say, drawn guro. While I wouldn't block either of those, I could certainly understand while someone would want to do so.
It'd be useful to have more options. So every ban reason having their own block list would be useful, though perhaps it'd be too much work, I'm not certain.

>>99dd668e-83a8-4e64-973e-e68efed2f898
Thanks mate, keep up the good work.

>>531ee5e4-4866-40a4-a5b8-88d5cbfe6cbe
My bigger problem is the way they phrased it.
>    ("It's just art" ain't going to fly sicko).
Sounds exactly like something I'd hear from Reddit. Hell, the UN released a report today saying the exact same thing.

>>8542b2bf-c9a2-4d10-8be4-1f45ff635516
Having the mod team spout reddit-talk? That totally shouldn't be a concern, goyim, trust me.

>>ac182689-a01f-4596-af8c-825c7c74fa7b
The reason cp is a crime specifically because of how it was produced you fucking idiot. Considering the fact that a child cannot legally consent, it's rape by definition, rape and child abuse all at once. No child was hurt in the act of drawing loli. There was no child to consent (or not consent) in the act of drawing loli. It is a victimless crime through and through.

I don't really care about the "hypocrisy" or the situation one way or another. There's many arguments to be made over "loli is pedo". I can't speak for anyone else, but myself, I see the situation as "pedo sure, but not a child molester", and there's an important distinction there. Being a pedophile is not a crime (maybe in Germany, they specialize in Thought Crimes), but being a child molester - acting out on your pedophilia - that is a crime. The two terms are often conflated in society, which is where this confusion comes from. Saying "loli is pedo" is accusatory in nature, even if it's not necessarily intended.
That's how I see the whole situation, at least. 

Either way however, pedo or not pedo, loli is perfectly legal and "eww, icky problematic drawing thought crimes!" is what retarded Redditors and Twitter trannies do. They try to "cancel" people over problematic drawings of children all the time. Look at Shadman. Why even come here if you'll bitch about loli?

>>1f1d43dd-ec14-437b-95a5-968535164e29
Rather, it's supply and demand. People who like loli will want more loli. Likewise, people who like CP will want more CP, which encourages production of CP. While consumption of CP does not hurt anyone, it encourages production of CP, which does harm children. This is the reason why distribution of CP is illegal, whereas "artistic depictions" like loli is not.

>>9de47a6e-c3c8-4aa2-842e-0c7c0252d28a
>Japan doesn't make any difference between those terms and uses them interchangeably.
Which is why loli's legal there and CP isn't, same as the US, right?
